hypothesis_content.title: Meme Coin (DOGE/PEPE) Intraday Volatility Reversion
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL or BULL regimes, when a meme coin (DOGE or PEPE) experiences an intraday (1-hour) price move exceeding +/- 7% on elevated volume (>1.5x 20-hour avg), a fade (short after a +7% spike, long after a -7% drop) at the close of that 1-hour candle will be profitable over the next 3 hours, with price reverting >30% of the initial spike/drop.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Meme coins are driven by retail sentiment and often exhibit 'pump and dump' or panic sell patterns. Extreme, high-volume intraday moves in non-stress regimes are frequently unsustainable as momentum chasers get exhausted, leading to swift partial retracements.
entry_conditions: Fade the move: Enter short if return > +7%, Enter long if return < -7% at the 1-hour candle close

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 30% of the initial 1-hour spike/drop move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves an additional 3% against the fade direction

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The 3-hour post-signal median return for the fade trade is <= 0%, indicating momentum continues more often than it reverts.
